articles.title: Churchill Downs Flags Prediction Markets in 2025 Earnings Call
articles.summary: Churchill Downs executives discussed prediction markets during their 2025 earnings call, signaling the horse racing giant's potential interest in the space. The company's entry would bring serious capital and regulatory expertise to prediction markets, potentially legitimizing the industry for mainstream retail adoption.

articles.title: The Prediction Market Debate Is Older Than You Think
articles.summary: Prediction markets aren't some Silicon Valley invention from the 2000s,economists and statisticians have been debating their merits and flaws for decades, if not centuries. Understanding this long history of skepticism and support helps explain why regulators still treat prediction markets like radioactive waste, despite mounting evidence of their forecasting power.

articles.title: Kalshi and Polymarket Are Economic Oracles
articles.summary: Prediction markets like Kalshi and Polymarket have evolved beyond entertainment betting into sophisticated economic forecasting tools that reveal real-time sentiment about everything from elections to inflation. Smart money is already using these platforms as leading indicators, making them essential reading for anyone trying to predict where markets and politics are heading next.

articles.title: 3 of the Best Prediction Market Stocks to Buy in 2026
articles.summary: Some finance writer thinks they've identified the top three prediction market stocks that will outperform in 2026. The picks probably matter less than the fact that Wall Street is finally treating prediction markets as a legitimate investment category worth tracking and ranking.

articles.title: Polymarket bettors appear to have insider-traded on a market designed to catch insider traders
articles.summary: Polymarket users allegedly used non-public information to profit on a market that was specifically created to detect and expose insider trading activity. The incident highlights how prediction markets struggle to police themselves and raises questions about whether platforms can effectively prevent the very behavior they're designed to catch.

articles.title: Kalshi bets on Neal Katyal in prediction market cases
articles.summary: Kalshi has hired former U.S. Solicitor General Neal Katyal to represent them in their ongoing legal battles over which prediction markets they can operate. This signals Kalshi is preparing for major Supreme Court-level fights that could determine whether prediction markets become mainstream or remain heavily restricted.

articles.title: Who will win Survivor 50? Predictions, odds after Survivor premiere
articles.summary: Survivor 50 just premiered and prediction markets are already pricing contestants' chances of taking home the $1 million prize. Reality TV betting has exploded into a legitimate market where social media sleuthing and gameplay analysis can give sharp bettors real edges over casual fans.

articles.title: "Survivor 50" hasn't aired yet, but Kalshi, Polymarket have picked a winner
articles.summary: Prediction markets on Kalshi and Polymarket are already pricing favorites for Survivor's milestone 50th season before it hits the airwaves. This marks another expansion of entertainment betting beyond traditional sports, showing how prediction markets are becoming the go-to platform for literally any outcome people want to speculate on.

articles.title: Supreme Court Could Decide Future of Sports Prediction Markets
articles.summary: The Supreme Court is weighing a case that could reshape how sports prediction markets operate in the US. A favorable ruling would likely open the floodgates for mainstream platforms to offer sports betting markets without navigating the current patchwork of state regulations.

articles.title: Prediction Markets May Have Inadvertently Outed Themselves as Casinos
articles.summary: Prediction markets are facing scrutiny after their behavior during recent events revealed they may function more like gambling platforms than information aggregation tools. This threatens their regulatory status and could force platforms to choose between operating as legitimate forecasting mechanisms or embracing their role as sophisticated betting exchanges.

articles.title: Gov. Cox took aim at sports betting apps. Kalshi is fighting back — in court.
articles.summary: Utah Governor Spencer Cox is targeting sports betting apps with new restrictions, and prediction market Kalshi has filed a lawsuit challenging the crackdown. The legal battle could set precedent for how states regulate prediction markets versus traditional sports betting, potentially reshaping the entire online wagering landscape.

articles.title: This Looks Like an Insider Bet on Aliens
articles.summary: Someone just dropped serious money on UFO disclosure bets, and the timing or bet size screams inside information. When whales start betting on low-probability events with suspicious confidence, smart money follows the unusual activity instead of the fundamentals.
